node.title: 'Robbery in the Skies': Dems Revive Bill to Regulate Airline Fees for Bags, Family Seats
node.description: The bill would allow the Department of Transportation to regulate fees to ensure they are "reasonable and proportional" to the cost imposed on the airline.

node.title: Lynlee Renick Convicted of Killing Snake-Breeder Husband to Collect His Life Insurance
node.description: Lynlee Renick was the sole beneficiary of a life-insurance policy for her husband amounting to $1 million and was having financial issues, prosecutors said.

node.title: Spotlight still shining on Black Caps spinner Ajaz Patel
node.description: It's almost been a week since Ajaz Patel wrote himself into the cricketing history books.

node.title: Diet Paratha: The community platform championing South Asian creatives
node.description: Anita Chhiba, the creative force behind an online platform championing South Asian culture, says the beauty of the platform is that it showcases South Asian people "free of cultural restraints".

node.title: Matthew Hunt's mother: 'He was only 28, he had his whole life ahead of him'
node.description: The mother of slain police officer Matthew Hunt says she wanted to face her son's killer in court for his cruel and callous actions.

node.title: FedEx poised to ship 100 million more packages this holiday season
node.description: The holiday rush comes as the shipping giant marks one year since transporting the first COVID vaccine.

node.title: Alex Murdaugh now facing more than 50 charges
node.description: Indictments filed Thursday allege Alex Murdaugh stole nearly $1.4 million.

node.title: Review: In a Gender-Flipped Revival, ‘Company’ Loves Misery
node.description: Bobby is now Bobbie in this confusing, sour remake of the 1970 musical by Stephen Sondheim and George Furth.

node.title: Rain-Soaked Rural Australia Asks: When Will It End?
node.description: After years of climate extremes, even the toughest, most community-minded Australians are desperate for a break from the deluge of disaster.

node.title: Taiwan Loses Nicaragua as Ally as Tensions With China Rise
node.description: The nation switched diplomatic allegiance to Beijing, leaving 13 nations and the Vatican still recognizing Taiwan as a sovereign nation.

node.title: 'Stop the Steal' Organizer Ali Alexander Served With Civil Suit After Meeting With 1/6 Panel
node.description: Video shows a man serving a summons to the rally organizer after he gave a closed-door deposition to Capitol riot investigators.

node.title: Joe Biden, Kamala Harris Tweets Backing Jussie Smollett Remain Up After Guilty Verdict
node.description: "This was an attempted modern day lynching," Harris wrote in her tweet.

node.title: JauMarcus McFarland's Mom Files Lawsuit After He's Crushed to Death by Elevator
node.description: The wrongful death lawsuit was filed against the owners of the building, three local elevator maintenance companies and the school McFarland was attending.

node.title: Former DEA Agent José Irizarry Sentenced After Shifting Millions From Stings to His Pockets
node.description: Irizarry filed false reports and ordered DEA staff to move money for undercover stings to international accounts owned by him and others, prosecutors said.

node.title: Fuel experts divided on impact of Marsden Point refinery closure
node.description: Aotearoa's fuel security fate is dividing experts and suppliers.

node.title: Three Waters Entities Bill delayed to allow feedback from working group
node.description: The legislation setting up the government's three waters entities has been delayed to give the working group time to recommend changes to governance and accountability.

node.title: Australia's Deputy PM tests positive for Covid-19
node.description: Barnaby Joyce tested positive for Covid-19 after experiencing mild symptoms shortly after arriving in the United States.

node.title: Government plan to stub out smoking draws mixed reactions
node.description: While a Māori public health agency is describing the government's smokefree plan as a "world first" step towards a healthier future, many dairy owners are worried they will have to shut up shop. Audio

node.title: Coroner recommends changes to Dunedin Hospital patient assessment
node.description: The coroner has recommended a change to the way patients are checked at Dunedin Hospital following the death of a patient in 2017.

node.title: Medical Council to put to GP 'serious concerns' over fraudulent vaccine exemptions
node.description: The Medical Council says it has begun gathering information "with urgency" in regard to a Kaiapoi GP who has been filmed handing out fraudulent vaccine exemption certificates at her clinic. Audio

node.title: Pollution regularly reaches harmful levels in some areas - report
node.description: A new comprehensive report shows air pollution is generally decreasing in most places, but still regularly reaches harmful levels.

node.title: Online platform showcases South Asian people 'free of cultural restraints'
node.description: Anita Chhiba, the creative force behind an online platform championing South Asian culture, says the beauty of the platform is that it showcases South Asian people "free of cultural restraints".

node.title: Covid-19: Ministry advised against early move to traffic lights
node.description: The Ministry of Health initially advised moving to the traffic light system only after 90 percent of the entire population - including children - were fully vaccinated.

node.title: Texas abortion law's enforcement mechanism not valid, judge rules
node.description: Planned Parenthood celebrated the ruling but said abortion services still remain "virtually inaccessible" in Texas.

node.title: Families forced to move after Navy fuel contaminates tap water
node.description: "How long have I been poisoning myself and my kids," one mother asked.

node.title: Robbie Shakespeare, Prolific Reggae Bassist, Is Dead at 68
node.description: As half of the duo Sly and Robbie, he performed or recorded with everyone from Peter Tosh and Grace Jones to Bob Dylan and Serge Gainsbourg.

node.title: What Do You Say to the Sufferer?
node.description: An attempt to be present with a stranger in pain.

node.title: How Is the U.S. Economy Doing?
node.description: Why do Americans say that the economy is awful but that they’re doing fine?

node.title: BuzzFeed’s stock drops nearly 24%, adding to a bad first week of trading.
node.description: The speed and depth of the decline in BuzzFeed’s stock may in part be because there is a small number of shares available to trade.

node.title: House Approves Post-Trump Curbs on Presidential Power
node.description: Republicans almost unanimously opposed the Protecting Our Democracy Act, which might be broken into separate components in the Senate.
